{"indexed":{"date-parts":[[2021,5,9]],"date-time":"2021-05-09T08:39:05Z","timestamp":1620549545767},"reference-count":70,"publisher":"IGI Global","content-domain":{"domain":[],"crossmark-restriction":false},"abstract":"Translating ethnographic field data to engineering requirements and design models suitable for implementing socio-technical systems is problematic. Ethnographic field data is often \u201cmessy\u201d and unstructured, while requirements models are organized and systematic. Cooperation and communication within an interdisciplinary design team makes the process even more complicated. A shared understanding between ethnographers, interaction designers, and software engineers is vital to ensure that complex and subtle social interactions present in the data are considered in the final system design. One solution for supporting team conversations uses the quality goal construct as a container for complex and ambiguous interaction attributes. Quality goals in system modelling promote shared understandings and collaborative design solutions by retaining a high level of abstraction for as long as possible during the design process. This chapter illustrates the effectiveness of abstract goals for conveying complex and ambiguous information in the design of a socio-technical system supporting social interaction between couples.<\/jats:p>","DOI":"10.4018\/978-1-5225-5969-6.ch007","type":"book-chapter","created":{"date-parts":[[2018,4,4]],"date-time":"2018-04-04T14:55:06Z","timestamp":1522853706000},"page":"226-261","source":"Crossref","is-referenced-by-count":0,"title":"Interdisciplinary Design Teams Translating Ethnographic Field Data Into Design Models","prefix":"10.4018","author":[{"given":"Jeni","family":"Paay","sequence":"first","affiliation":[{"name":"Swinburne University of Technology, Australia"}]},{"given":"Leon","family":"Sterling","sequence":"additional","affiliation":[{"name":"Swinburne University of Technology, Australia"}]},{"given":"Sonja","family":"Pedell","sequence":"additional","affiliation":[{"name":"Swinburne University of Technology, Australia"}]},{"given":"Frank","family":"Vetere","sequence":"additional","affiliation":[{"name":"The University of Melbourne, Australia"}]},{"given":"Steve","family":"Howard","sequence":"additional","affiliation":[{"name":"The University of Melbourne, Australia"}]}],"member":"2432","reference":[{"key":"978-1-5225-5969-6.ch007.-1","unstructured":"Aoki, P.
